## BioCro

BioCro is a model that predicts plant growth over time given
crop-specific parameters and environmental data as input.

It uses models of key physiological and biophysical processes underlying
plant growth ([Humphries and Long,
1995](https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/11.4.361)), and has
previously been used for predicting biomass yield and leaf area index of
switchgrass and miscanthus ([Miguez et al.,
2009](https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1757-1707.2009.01019.x)). In 2022,
BioCro was reorganized to take a truly modular approach to modeling
([Lochocki et al.,
2022](https://doi.org/10.1093/insilicoplants/diac003)) and a new soybean
model was developed ([Matthews et al.,
2022](https://doi.org/10.1093/insilicoplants/diab032)).

BioCro has also been integrated into a suite of tools that link the
model directly to crop trait and yield data ([LeBauer et al.,
2013](https://doi.org/10.1890/12-0137.1)). The Predictive Ecosystem
Analyzer ([PEcAn](https://github.com/PecanProject/pecan)) couples BioCro
to the [Biofuel Ecophysiological Traits and Yields
database](https://github.com/PecanProject/bety).

See [References](#references) below for a full list of scientific
publications using the BioCro framework.

### An example

The [`run_biocro()`](reference/run_biocro.md) function accepts initial
values, parameters, climate variables, and sets of modules to run. It
returns the results in a data frame.

``` r
library(BioCro)
library(lattice)

result <- with(soybean, {run_biocro(
  initial_values,
  parameters,
  soybean_weather$'2002',
  direct_modules,
  differential_modules,
  ode_solver
)})

xyplot(Stem + Leaf ~ TTc, data = result, type='l', auto = TRUE)
```

There are parameters and modules for soybean (*Glycine max*), miscanthus
(*Miscanthus* x *giganteus*), and willow (*Saliceae salix*).

### Simple installation

BioCro is available on CRAN, so it can be installed from R as follows:

``` r
install.packages('BioCro')
```

### Installation from source

#### Requirements

- The [R environment](https://cran.r-project.org/) version 3.6.0 or
  greater.
- On Windows, a version of
  [Rtools](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/) appropriate
  for your version of R.
- On Linux, gcc and g++ version 4.9.3 or greater (consult documentation
  for your distribution for installation instructions).
- On MacOS, Xcode.

#### Installation steps

1.  Obtain a local copy of this repository, making sure to include the
    Git submodule code. This can be accomplished using either of two
    methods:
    1.  If you are new to Git, the easiest way to get a local copy is to
        install GitHub Desktop and use the “Open with GitHub Desktop”
        option in the “Code” dropdown on the GitHub page for this
        repository.
    2.  Alternatively, clone the repository using Git on the command
        line in the usual fashion by running
        `git clone https://github.com/biocro/biocro` The repository
        contains a Git submodule, so you will need to take the
        additional step of running `git submodule update --init` to
        obtain it.
2.  Install the BioCro R package using one of the following sets of
    comands. These assume that the source files are in a directory named
    “biocro” residing in a parent directory located at
    “path_to_source_code_parent_directory”.
    1.  To install from the command line:

            cd path_to_source_code_parent_directory
            R CMD INSTALL biocro

    2.  To install from within R:

            setwd('path_to_source_code_parent_directory')
            install.packages('biocro', repos=NULL, type='SOURCE')

### Making contributions

Please see the contribution guidelines before submitting changes. These
may be found in Chapter One of the *Developer’s Manual* on the [public
BioCro Documentation web site](https://biocro.org).

### Software Documentation

See the [public BioCro Documentation web site](https://biocro.org).
There will be found not only the usual package documentation, but also
documentation of the C++ code, including notes on the biological models
used in BioCro and their implementation. Also included is documentation
for BioCro package developers and maintainers.

There is also a separate [page that documents all of the quantities used
by the Standard BioCro Module
Library](https://biocro.org/BioCro-documentation/quantity_docs/quantities.html).

### License

The `BioCro` R package is licensed under the MIT license, while the
BioCro C++ framework is licensed under version 3 or greater of the GNU
Lesser General Public License (LGPL). This scheme allows people to
freely develop models for any use (public or private) under the MIT
license, but any changes to the framework that assembles and solves
models must make source code changes available to all users under the
LGPL. See `LICENSE.note` for more details.

### Citing BioCro

Appropriate references for BioCro are [Miguez et
al. (2009)](https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1757-1707.2009.01019.x) and
[Lochocki et
al. (2022)](https://doi.org/10.1093/insilicoplants/diac003), with
details given below. To cite the package itself, use
`citation('BioCro')` in R to get details for the current installed
version.

### References

- [Humphries S and Long
  SP](https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/11.4.361) (1995) WIMOVAC: a
  software package for modelling the dynamics of plant leaf and canopy
  photosynthesis. Computer Applications in the Biosciences 11(4):
  361-371.
- [Miguez FE, Zhu XG, Humphries S, Bollero GA, Long
  SP](https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1757-1707.2009.01019.x) (2009) A
  semimechanistic model predicting the growth and production of the
  bioenergy crop Miscanthus × giganteus: description, parameterization
  and validation. Global Change Biology Bioenergy 1: 282-296.
- [LeBauer D, Wang D, Richter K, Davidson C, Dietze
  M](https://doi.org/10.1890/12-0137.1) (2013) Facilitating feedbacks
  between field measurements and ecosystem models. Ecological Monographs
  83(2): 133-154.
- [Wang D, Jaiswal D, Lebauer DS, Wertin TM, Bollero GA, Leakey ADB,
  Long SP](https://doi.org/10.1111/pce.12556) (2015) A physiological and
  biophysical model of coppice willow (Salix spp.) production yields for
  the contiguous USA in current and future climate scenarios. Plant,
  Cell & Environment 38(9): 1850-1865.
- [Larsen S, Jaiswal D, Bentsen NS, Wang D, Long
  SP](https://doi.org/10.1111/gcbb.12318) (2015) Comparing predicted
  yield and yield stability of willow and Miscanthus across Denmark. GCB
  Bioenergy 8(6): 1061-1070.
- [Jaiswal D, de Souza AP, Larsen S, LeBauer D, Miguez FE, Sparovek G,
  Bollero G, Buckeridge MS, Long
  SP](https://doi.org/10.1038/nclimate3410) (2017) Brazilian sugarcane
  ethanol as an expandable green alternative to crude oil use. Nature
  Climate Change 7(11): 788-792.
- [Lochocki EB, Rohde S, Jaiswal D, Matthews ML, Miguez FE, Long SP,
  McGrath JM](https://doi.org/10.1093/insilicoplants/diac003) (2022)
  BioCro II: a software package for modular crop growth simulations. *in
  silico* Plants 4(1): diac003.
- [Matthews ML, Marshall-Colón A, McGrath JM, Lochocki EB, Long
  SP](https://doi.org/10.1093/insilicoplants/diab032) (2022)
  Soybean-BioCro: a semi-mechanistic model of soybean growth. *in
  silico* Plants 4(1): diab032.
- [He Y, Jaiswal D, Liang XZ, Sun C, Long
  SP](https://doi.org/10.1111/gcbb.12937) (2022) Perennial biomass crops
  on marginal land improve both regional climate and agricultural
  productivity. GCB Bioenergy 14(5): 558-571.
- [He Y, Matthews ML](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.fcr.2023.108907) (2023)
  Seasonal climate conditions impact the effectiveness of improving
  photosynthesis to increase soybean yield. Field Crops Research 296:
  108907.
- [Holland B, Matthews ML, Bota P, Sweetlove LJ, Long SP, diCenzo
  GC](https://doi.org/10.1111/nph.19203) (2023) A genome-scale metabolic
  reconstruction of soybean and Bradyrhizobium diazoefficiens reveals
  the cost–benefit of nitrogen fixation. New Phytologist 240(2):
  744-756.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`add_time_to_weather_data()`](add_time_to_weather_data.md) : Add a
  time component to input
- [`annualDB`](annualDB.md) [`annualDB2`](annualDB.md) : Miscanthus dry
  biomass data.
- [`catm_data`](catm_data.md) : Global annual mean atmopspheric CO2
  levels
- [`soybean_weather`](cmi_soybean_weather_data.md) : Champaign, IL
  weather data for Soybean-BioCro
- [`weather`](cmi_weather_data.md) : Champaign, IL weather data
- [`compare_model_output()`](compare_model_output.md) : Compare new and
  stored results for a BioCro model test case
- [`crop_model_definitions`](crop_model_definitions.md) : Crop model
  definitions
- [`default_ode_solvers`](default_ode_solvers.md) : Default ODE solver
  settings
- [`validate_dynamical_system_inputs()`](dynamical_system.md) :
  Validating dynamical system inputs
- [`get_all_modules()`](get_all.md) [`get_all_quantities()`](get_all.md)
  [`get_all_ode_solvers()`](get_all.md) : Get lists of modules,
  quantities, and solvers
- [`get_growing_season_climate()`](get_growing_season_climate.md) :
  Truncate weather data to one growing season
- [`miscanthus_x_giganteus`](miscanthus_x_giganteus.md) : Miscanthus
  model definition
- [`model_test_case()`](model_test_case.md) : Define BioCro model test
  cases
- [`model_testing`](model_testing.md) : The BioCro model testing system
- [`initialize_csv()`](module_case_files.md)
  [`add_csv_row()`](module_case_files.md)
  [`update_csv_cases()`](module_case_files.md) : Define and modify
  BioCro module test case files
- [`module_creators()`](module_creators.md) : Create instances of
  modules
- [`module_paste()`](module_paste.md) : Prepend library name to module
  names
- [`module_testing`](module_testing.md) : The BioCro module testing
  system
- [`module_write()`](module_write.md) : Generate a BioCro module header
  file.
- [`module_info()`](modules.md)
  [`quantity_list_from_names()`](modules.md)
  [`evaluate_module()`](modules.md)
  [`module_response_curve()`](modules.md) : BioCro module functions
- [`obsBea`](obsBea.md) : Miscanthus assimilation field data
- [`obsBeaC`](obsBeaC.md) : Complete Miscanthus assimilation field data
- [`obsNaid`](obsNaid.md) : Miscanthus assimilation data
- [`partial_run_biocro()`](partial_application.md)
  [`partial_evaluate_module()`](partial_application.md) : Convenience
  Functions for Partial Application
- [`run_biocro()`](run_biocro.md) : Simulate Crop Growth with BioCro
- [`run_model_test_cases()`](run_model_test_cases.md) : Run BioCro model
  test cases
- [`soil_parameters`](soil_parameters.md) : Soil properties
- [`soybean`](soybean.md) : Soybean-BioCro model definition
- [`soybean_clock`](soybean_clock.md) : Soybean-BioCro circadian clock
  model definition
- [`system_derivatives()`](system_derivatives.md) : Calculate
  Derivatives for Differential Quantities
- [`test_module()`](test_module.md) [`case()`](test_module.md)
  [`cases_from_csv()`](test_module.md) : Run BioCro module test cases
- [`test_module_library()`](test_module_library.md) : Run module test
  cases for an entire BioCro module library
- [`Time Variable`](time_variable.rd) [`time`](time_variable.rd) : The
  \`time\` variable in BioCro
- [`update_stored_model_results()`](update_stored_model_results.md) :
  Updated stored result for a BioCro model test case
- [`willow`](willow.md) : Willow model definition
